definitions.definition: To fall back again; to slide or turn back into a former state or practice.
examples: He has improved recently but keeps relapsing into states of utter confusion.
to relapse into a stupor, into vice, or into barbarism
to relapse into slumber after being disturbed

definitions.definition: To recur ; to worsen , be aggravated ( after a period of improvement ) .
To return to a vice , especially self-harm or alcoholism , failing to maintain abstinence .
examples: relapsed after 5 months of being clean

definitions.definition: To slip or slide back physically; to turn back .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To fall back again; to slide or turn back into a former state or practice.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , medicine , of a disease ) To recur ; to worsen , be aggravated ( after a period of improvement ) .
( intransitive , informal , specifically ) To return to a vice , especially self-harm or alcoholism , failing to maintain abstinence .
To slip or slide back physically; to turn back .
